conversation.speaker: USER
conversation.text: I'm in the mood for a comedy-drama movie. Could you recommend a few?

conversation.speaker: SYSTEM
conversation.text:
I'd highly recommend "Madagascar"! It's a hilarious adventure where a group of animals from New York Zoo find themselves in Madagascar, learning to survive and adapt to their new home. Plus, it features some fantastic voices like Cedric the Entertainer, Andy Richter, and Jada Pinkett Smith.

If you're up for a unique comedy-drama blend, "The Wendell Baker Story" is another great choice. It follows Luke Wilson as an ex-con helping three elderly residents in a retirement hotel while trying to win back his girlfriend. Eddie Griffin and Will Ferrell lend their comedic talents to this one as well!

conversation.text: I'd highly recommend "Four Christmases" for its heartwarming comedy about a couple trying to spend the holidays with all their divorced parents. It stars an impressive cast including Robert Duvall and Sissy Spacek. Another great choice is "Monty Python and the Holy Grail", a hilarious quest for the Holy Grail that's brimming with silliness, featuring the legendary comedy troupe Monty Python. Enjoy!

conversation.text: Both 'Ant-Man' and 'Top Five' might be great choices for you! 'Ant-Man' is a fun, action-packed film where a cat burglar dons a super-suit that makes him shrink but grow in strength, all while saving the world. On the other hand, 'Top Five' offers a mix of comedy and drama as a comedian navigates the transition from stand-up to serious actor, with an interesting cast including the talented Rosario Dawson and Chris Rock. I recommend giving either one a watch!

conversation.text: I'd highly recommend "Time Bandits" for you! This whimsical adventure comedy, starring John Cassavetes alongside the likes of Sean Connery and Shelley Duvall, tells a fantastical story of time travel and dwarves in search of treasure across various historical eras. It's an entertaining and unique journey that perfectly aligns with your preference for comedies featuring Cassavetes. However, if you prefer a more grounded film, "The Terminal" starring Tom Hanks might also interest you. This drama-comedy is about an Eastern European tourist who ends up living indefinitely at JFK Airport due to political complications. Both films are great choices and I hope you enjoy them!

Another film you might enjoy is "The Truman Show" - a thought-provoking drama starring Jim Carrey about an insurance salesman who discovers his entire life is a reality TV show! Both movies are engaging and offer unique perspectives on relationships and identity. Enjoy the watch!
